oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On the structural and magnetic properties of R2Fe17 - x(A,T)x (R = Rare Earth; A = Al, Si, Ga; T = Transition Metal) compounds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAMA RAO, KVS
EHRENBERG, H
MARKANDEYULU, G
VARADARAJU, UV
VENKATESAN, M
SURESH, KG
MURTHY, VS
SCHMIDT, PC
FUESS, H
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: magnetic moments
electronic structure
magnetic properties
hydrogenation
rare earth compounds
hydrides
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: R2Fe17 (R = rare earth) constitute one of the most important classes of materials identified as high-energy permanent magnet materials. They crystallize either in the rhombohedral Th2Zn17 structure (for light R) or in the hexagonal Th2Ni17 structure (for heavy R). In this article, we discuss the variations in the lattice parameters (unit cell volume), site occupancies and Curie temperature when non-transition and transition metals are substituted for Fe in R2Fe17 compounds.
